subject: Science
title: What Is Electric Charge?
description: A 60-second lesson on What Is Electric Charge?.

hook.text: Rub a balloon on your hair and it sticks to the wall. That's electric charge at work.

buildup.text: All matter contains protons (positive) and electrons (negative). Normally they balance out.

discovery.text: Rubbing transfers electrons between objects, leaving one positive and the other negative.

twist.text: Opposite charges attract. Like charges repel. This simple rule drives all of electricity.

climax.text: The force between charges is incredibly strong â€” trillions of times stronger than gravity.

punchline.text: Electric force dwarfs gravity. A tiny balloon beats Earth's pull on your hair.

quiz.question: What happens when you rub a balloon on your hair?
options: Electrons transfer, creating a charge imbalance
